results.title: Multimedia Mozart: the dissonant quartet (PC)
results.brief_description: The Dissonant Quartet is an elucidating, captivating exploration of the man and his music, from the emotional dynamics of the String Quartet in C Major, to the historic events in his world, to the expressive beauty of the individual stringed instruments. Experience the power of Mozart’s artistry and the intensity of his genius. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: a multimedia PC or compatible with 386SX or higher microprocessor, 2MB of RAM, 30MB of hard-disk, CDROM -drive, audio board and VGA display. Microsoft Windows and MS-DOS operating system, versions 3.1 or later.

results.title: Multimedia Beethoven: the ninth symphony (PC)
results.brief_description: The Ninth Symphony will arouse your senses, stir your imagination and change forever the way you experience music. The composer’s life is examined along with the cultural, social and political events which influenced him, and the musical composition are considered also as components of the Ninth Symphony are broken down and analysed. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: A multimedia PC or compatiblewith a 386SX microprocessor, 4.5 MB of memory, at least 4MB of hard-disk space, CDROM drive, audio board, and VGA+ monitor. MS-DOS operating system and Microsoft Windows, versions 3.1 or later,

results.title: Multicultural Australia
results.brief_description: Richard Morecroft looks at popular images of Australia, “Australianness” and Australian culture, in an attempt to define what being an Australian means. Useful in the studies of immigration, problems of refugees, Australian history and Australian life.

results.title: Muloorina
results.creator_credit: David Cobham, Ronald H. Riley, Cinesound and Film Producers Guild
results.brief_description: In 1962 Donald Campbell made his second attempt to break the worl land speed record on the salt flats of Lake Eyre, 35 miles north-east of Muloorina, a homestead 450 miles north of Adelaide, and settled by Elliot Price and his family in 1939; their struggle to establish a sheep station on the drought ridden land and the effect Campbell’s attempt had on the homestead.

results.title: Mullet [DVD]
results.creator_credit: David Caesar, Vincent Sheehan, New South Wales Film and Television Office and Premium Movie Partnership
results.brief_description: Eddie Maloney (Ben Mendelsohn) whose nickname is ‘Mullet’ (aptly named after a fish that no-one likes eating), unexpectedly returns home to Coollawarra after a three year absence. Surprisingly, not many people are too happy to see him back in town, particularly his estranged family who greet his arrival with some apprehension. None more so than his law enforcing brother Pete (Andrew Gilbert) who is now married to Eddie’s childhood sweetheart, Tully (Susie Porter). David Caesar’s understated screenplay interweaves pointed metaphor to explore the ties that bind and separate family. The story unfolds through a series of well observed and familiar characterizations, while unashamedly wearing it’s Australianness on it’s sleeve. The vibrant cinematography by Robert Humphreys gives the story a sense of magic realism, while the characters quiet musical interludes are surprisingly and nicely understated. Cast includes Belinda McClory, Kris McQuade, Tony Barry, Peta Brady and Wayne Blair.

results.title: Mull
results.creator_credit: Don McLennan, D. Howard Grigsby and Ukiyo Films
results.brief_description: Based on the popular novel “Mullaway” by Bron Nicholls, “Mull” is the story of a 16 year old girl’s struggle to turn 17, movingly portrayed by Nadine Garner in an AFI Award winning performance. Mull’s brother is a junkie, her father’s a religious fanatic and her mum’s about to die. So Mull does what she has to do and gives up school to keep the family together any way she can. Other notable performances are from Bill Hunter, Sue Jones and Mary Coustas.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don McLennan, D. Howard Grigsby and Ukiyo Films

results.title: Mules and tail operation
results.creator_credit: Tom Price and Australian Wool Corporation
results.brief_description: The modified mules operation and the tail-strip operation now being increasingly practised by wool-growers in Australia is demonstrated in this informative film. The saving in time, money and labour effected by wool-growers who carry out these operations correctly is emphasised.

results.title: Mulan
results.creator_credit: Barry Cook, Tony Bancroft, Pam Coats and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: A remarkable epic about honour, courage and the family spirit, Mulan chronicles the daring adventures of a young Chinese woman whose irrepressible spirit clashes with her tradition-bound society. When her country is forced into war by the invading Hun army, Mulan searches deep within herself, takes her ailing father’s conscription notice, and joins the Chinese army in order to save his life. Features the voices of Ming-Na Wen, Lea Salonga, Eddie Murphy, Miguel Ferrer, B.D. Wong and Donny Osmond.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barry Cook, Tony Bancroft, Pam Coats and Walt Disney Pictures

results.title: Muhammad: legacy of a prophet [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Michael Schwarz, Omar Al-Qattan, Alexander Kronemer, Liz Gray, Michael Wolfe, Kikim Media, KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.) and Unity Productions Foundation
results.brief_description: Born in the year 570 in Mecca, Arabia, his father having died before his birth, and his mother dying when he was only six, Muhammad, sheltered by a powerful uncle, made a good start in life, establishing himself in a profitable business and marrying well. And then, at the age of 40, he was transformed. A man who could not read or write, he announced that he was the prophet of God, and in the next 23 years he would bring peace to the warring pagan tribes of Arabia and establish the new religion of Islam, which today has 1.2 billion followers. With some of the world’s greatest scholars on Islam providing historical context and critical perspective, and through paintings, archival resources, ancient artefacts and re-enactments, this superb documentary film presents an in depth discourse on the life and legacy of the Prophet Muhammad - a story that has relied solely on oral history and the recorded word passed down from the 7th century because, unlike the figure of Jesus Christ in the Christian belief, there are no images of the Prophet Muhammad for he was not seen as a “divine” figure by his followers. Muhammad’s legacy brings us to today’s Muslims and the preconception, particularly by the West and especially since 9/11, that they are terrorists and fanatics. This program sets out to dispel the myths and misunderstandings by taking the viewer into the homes, mosques and work places of American Muslims (6-7 million in America, many who have immigrated from Iraq during the Gulf War) who openly talk of their faith, and their beliefs and values that shape their lives, commenting that fanaticism and acts of terrorism are contrary to the beliefs of Islam. Shot on location in the Middle East, Europe and the United States, this documentary program took three years to complete but the result is probably one of the most comprehensive chronicles produced on the life of the Prophet Muhammad and the Islamic religion. Narrated by Andre Braugher.
